summary.title: Bedrohungsmodell - OTT Auth
summary.description: Die Firma Allsecure betreibt unterschiedliche Anwendungen mit Hilfe einer 2-Faktorauthentifizierung via One-time token, der an das entsprechende Smartphone des Nutzers geschickt wird.

data.name:
Login System -
Webapp +
Mobile App
data.description: Vergleicht eingegebenen OTT-Wert auf Telefon mit erwartetem OTT seitens 2-Faktor-Dienst.

threats.title: DDoS
threats.description:
Ein DDoS Angriff kann den Login-Dienst überlasten und somit für Anwender unerreichbar machen. 

CAPEC-125: Flooding: An adversary consumes the resources of a target by rapidly engaging in a large number of interactions with the target.

ATT&CK: TA0038 - Network Effects: The adversary is trying to intercept or manipulate network traffic to or from a device.

D: 8 / R: 10 / E: 8 / A: 10 / DREA: 36
threats.mitigation:
Firewall, Load-Balancer oder CDN einsetzen, um direkten Datenverkehr auf Login-Server zu begrenzen.

DEFEND: D3-ITF - Inbound Traffic Filtering
ASVS: CWE 770 (8.1.4): Verify the application can detect and alert on abnormal numbers of requests, such as by IP, user, total per hour or day, or whatever makes sense for the application.

D: 4 / R: 10 / E: 4 / A: 10 / Neuer DREA: 28

threats.title: Elevation of privalage
threats.description:
An internal attacker can gain access to sensitive data due to the app-data being commonly accessible to the other Allsecure apps through the SD-card.

CAPEC-233: Privilege Escalation An adversary exploits a weakness enabling them to elevate their privilege and perform an action that they are not supposed to be authorized to perform.

D: 8 / R: 10 / E: 8 / A: 10 / DREA: 36
threats.mitigation:
Create App-specific directories inside the SD-card and store the data after encryption

Mitigation: ID: M1022; T1222: File and Directory Permissions Modification: Applying more restrictive permissions to files and directories could prevent adversaries from modifying their access control lists.

ASVS: CWE 285 (4.1.3): Verify that the principle of least privilege exists - users should only be able to access functions, data files, URLs, controllers, services, and other resources, for which they possess specific authorization. This implies protection against spoofing and elevation of privilege.

D: 6 / R: 6 / E: 4 / A: 10 / DREA: 26

threats.title: Spoofing
threats.description:
Having a one year long lived authentication session can lead to spoofing, as it leaves the attacker with plenty of time to impersonate a user by compromising the session.

CAPEC-151: Identity Spoofing: Identity Spoofing refers to the action of assuming (i.e., taking on) the identity of some other entity (human or non-human) and then using that identity to accomplish a goal. An adversary may craft messages that appear to come from a different principle or use stolen / spoofed authentication credentials.

ATT&CK: 1134 Access Token Manipulation: Adversaries may modify access tokens to operate under a different user or system security context to perform actions and bypass access controls. 

D: 10 / R: 8 / E: 7 / A: 8 / DREA: 33
threats.mitigation:
Use short-term lived tokens for authentication.

M1036:Account Use Policies	:Where possible, consider restricting the use of authentication material outside of expected contexts.

M1013:Application Developer Guidance	: Consider implementing token binding strategies, such as Azure AD token protection or OAuth Proof of Possession, that cryptographically bind a token to a secret. This may prevent the token from being used without knowledge of the secret or possession of the device the token is tied to.[6][7]

CWE 306 (3.7.1):Verify the application ensures a full, valid login session or requires re-authentication or secondary verification before allowing any sensitive transactions or account modifications.
CWE 613 (3.3.2):If authenticators permit users to remain logged in, verify that re-authentication occurs periodically both when actively used or after an idle period. (C6)

D: 6 / R: 4 / E: 4 / A: 6 / DREA: 20

threats.title: Information disclosure
threats.description:
The attacker can intercept the unencrypted data in the internal network.

CAPEC-117: Interception: An adversary monitors data streams to or from the target for information gathering purposes.

T1557: Adversary-in-the-Middle::Adversaries may attempt to position themselves between two or more networked devices using an adversary-in-the-middle (AiTM) technique to support follow-on behaviors such as Network Sniffing, Transmitted Data Manipulation, or replay attacks (Exploitation for Credential Access).

D: 8 / R: 8 / E: 7 / A: 8 / DREA: 31
threats.mitigation:
Encrypt the data in transit as the devices can be compromised or internal attackers can gat access to data in plain-text.

Mitigation: M1041: Encrypt Sensitive Information: Ensure that all wired and/or wireless traffic is encrypted appropriately. Use best practices for authentication protocols, such as Kerberos, and ensure web traffic that may contain credentials is protected by SSL/TLS.

ASVS: CWE 319 (9.2.2):	Verify that encrypted communications such as TLS is used for all inbound and outbound connections, including for management ports, monitoring, authentication, API, or web service calls, database, cloud, serverless, mainframe, external, and partner connections. The server must not fall back to insecure or unencrypted protocols.

D: 5 / R: 6 / E: 5 / A: 5 / DREA: 21

threats.title: Spoofing von Kundendaten
threats.description:
Angreifer kann sich als "legitimer" Kunde ausgeben, um an kritische Daten / Dienste zu gelangen zu denen er eigentlich keinen Zugriff haben dürfte (Social Engineering beim Kundendienst).

CAPEC ID: 148: Content Spoofing: An adversary modifies content to make it contain something other than what the original content producer intended while keeping the apparent source of the content unchanged.
Att&ck: T1557 (Adversary-in-the-Middle)

D: 9 / R: 8 / E: 5 / A: 4 / DREA: 26
threats.mitigation:
Personal schulen, Kritische Kundendaten als solche für Mitarbeiter in der Support-Software markieren, um Irrtümer zu vermeiden. 

Defend Matrix: D3-NTCD: Network Traffic Community Deviation
ASVS: 1.8.1 : Verify that all sensitive data is identified and classified into protection levels.

D: 4 / R: 4 / E: 2 / A: 4 / Neuer DREA: 14

threats.title: Tampering
threats.description:
An attacker can intercept the logs being sent to the log-DB, or gain access to the database and alter the data to hide his tracks.

CAPEC-93: Log Injection-Tampering-Forging:This attack targets the log files of the target host. The attacker injects, manipulates or forges malicious log entries in the log file, allowing them to mislead a log audit, cover traces of attack, or perform other malicious actions.

ATT&CK :.001	Stored Data Manipulation	Adversaries may insert, delete, or manipulate data at rest in order to influence external outcomes or hide activity, thus threatening the integrity of the data. 
.002	Transmitted Data Manipulation	Adversaries may alter data en route to storage or other systems in order to manipulate external outcomes or hide activity, thus threatening the integrity of the data. 

D: 9 / R: 8 / E: 7 / A: 8 / DREA: 32
threats.mitigation:
Mitigation: M1041:Encrypt Sensitive Information: Consider encrypting important information to reduce an adversary’s ability to perform tailored data modifications.

CWE 117 (7.3.1): Verify that all logging components appropriately encode data to prevent log injection. (C9)
CWE 200(7.3.3): Verify that security logs are protected from unauthorized access and modification. (C9)

D: 5 / R: 4 / E: 4 / A: 4 / DREA: 17

threats.title: Repudiation
threats.description:
An attacker triggers a certain log that can't be tranced back to him, and which the real user of the account denies.
D: 9 / R: 7 / E: 6 / A: 9 / DREA: 31
threats.mitigation:
Location sensitive trigger alert, on top of real time suspicious activity alert sent to both the user and management instantly .

CWE 212( 7.4.1): Verify that a generic message is shown when an unexpected or security sensitive error occurs, potentially with a unique ID which support personnel can use to investigate. (C10)
D: 6 / R: 4/ E: 4 / A: 4 / DREA: 18

threats.title: Denial of service
threats.description:
The attacker sends large amount of OTT requests to the OTT service, leading to it getting overwhelmed and denying real requests.

CAPEC-125: Flooding: An adversary consumes the resources of a target by rapidly engaging in a large number of interactions with the target. This type of attack generally exposes a weakness in rate limiting or flow.

ATT&CK: T1499 Endpoint Denial of Service: .002 Service Exhaustion Flood Adversaries may target the different network services provided by systems to conduct a denial of service (DoS). 

D: 8 / R: 8 / E: 7 / A: 10 / DREA: 33
threats.mitigation:
Implementing rate-limiting mechanisms, and load-balancing. 

M1037: Filter Network Traffic: Leverage services provided by Content Delivery Networks (CDN) or providers specializing in DoS mitigations to filter traffic upstream from services.[4] Filter boundary traffic by blocking source addresses sourcing the attack, blocking ports that are being targeted, or blocking protocols being used for transport.

ASVS: CWE 770 (8.1.4): Verify the application can detect and alert on abnormal numbers of requests, such as by IP, user, total per hour or day, or whatever makes sense for the application.

D: 4 / R: 8 / E: 4 / A: 10 / Neuer DREA: 26
